info.title: IA-Connect SAP GUI
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for automating the SAP GUI application.

post.description: Enables SAP scripting in the SAP GUI. This setting must also be enabled on the SAP server by setting the 'sapgui/user_scripting' parameter value to TRUE.

NotifyWhenScriptAttachesToGUI.title: Notify when script attaches to GUI
NotifyWhenScriptAttachesToGUI.description: Should SAPGUI notify the user when a script attaches to the GUI? This presents a popup box and therefore should be disabled for automation.

NotifyWhenScriptOpensConnection.title: Notify when script opens connection
NotifyWhenScriptOpensConnection.description: Should SAPGUI notify the user when a script attaches to the GUI? This presents a popup box and therefore should be disabled for automation.

ShowNativeWindowsDialogs.title: Show native windows dialogs
ShowNativeWindowsDialogs.description: Should native Windows dialogs be displayed (e.g. Save As, Open) rather than the replacement SAP dialogs?

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Enables SAP scripting and launches SAP GUI. This is the first step towards automating SAP GUI if it was not already running.

SAPLogonEXE.title: SAPLogon EXE
SAPLogonEXE.description: The full path to SAPLogon.exe. If left blank, IA-Connect will attempt to detect it automatically.

SAPLogonArguments.title: SAPLogon arguments
SAPLogonArguments.description: Provide any optional command-line arguments for SAPLogon.exe here, if required.

EnableSAPScripting.title: Enable SAP scripting
EnableSAPScripting.description: Should SAP scripting be enabled? If set to true (the default), SAP scripting will be enabled. If set to false, the current SAP scripting setting will be used.

NotifyWhenScriptAttachesToGUI.title: Notify when script attaches to GUI
NotifyWhenScriptAttachesToGUI.description: Should SAPGUI notify the user when a script attaches to the GUI? This presents a popup box and therefore should be disabled for automation.

NotifyWhenScriptOpensConnection.title: Notify when script opens connection
NotifyWhenScriptOpensConnection.description: Should SAPGUI notify the user when a script attaches to the GUI? This presents a popup box and therefore should be disabled for automation.

ShowNativeWindowsDialogs.title: Show native windows dialogs
ShowNativeWindowsDialogs.description: Should native Windows dialogs be displayed (e.g. Save As, Open) rather than the replacement SAP dialogs?

AttachAfterLaunch.title: Attach after launch
AttachAfterLaunch.description: Should IA-Connect attempt to attach to SAPGUI automatically? By default, this is set to true.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The number of seconds that IA-Connect will wait for SAPGUI to launch before attempting to attach to it.

SAPProgId.title: SAPGUI prog Id
SAPProgId.description: The SAP program ID. This defaults to 'SAPGUI' and should only be changed if advised by your SAP administrator.

DisableSystemMessages.title: Disable system messages
DisableSystemMessages.description: Should system messages be disabled? These are typically sent by the SAP administrator and create additional popup dialogs so therefore should be disabled for automation.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SAPGUIMajorVersion.title: SAPGUI major version
SAPGUIMajorVersion.description: The SAPGUI major version, for example 7400.

SAPGUIPatchLevel.title: SAPGUI patch level
SAPGUIPatchLevel.description: The SAPGUI patch level, for example 11.

SAPGUIMinorVersion.title: SAPGUI minor version
SAPGUIMinorVersion.description: The SAPGUI minor version, for example 257.

SAPGUINewVisualDesign.title: SAPGUI using new visual design
SAPGUINewVisualDesign.description: Returns true if SAPGUI is using the new visual design, or false if not.

post.description: Attaches to an instance of SAP GUI which is already running. This is the first step towards automating SAP GUI if SAP GUI was already running.

NumberOfSAPConnections.title: Number of SAP connections

ConnectedToSession.title: Connected to session
ConnectedToSession.description: Returns true if IA-Connect is currently connected to an SAP session.

SessionError.title: Session connection error
SessionError.description: Returns any error messages reported by the SAP session.

SessionName.title: Session name
SessionName.description: The name of the session IA-Connect is connected to.

SessionSystemName.title: Session system name
SessionSystemName.description: The name of the system that the currently connected session is connected to, for example NPL.

post.description: Returns a list of running SAP sessions. This information is useful if you wish to attach to an existing SAP connection / session but you don't know which ones are available.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfSAPConnections.title: Number of SAP connections
NumberOfSAPConnections.description: Returns the number of SAP connections that are currently open.

SAPConnectionsJSON.title: SAP connections JSON
SAPConnectionsJSON.description: The properties of the open SAP connections, in JSON format. This list will contain properties such as the connection name, the connection description and the number of sessions that are currently open in the connection.

NumberOfSAPSessions.title: Number of SAP sessions
NumberOfSAPSessions.description: Returns the number of SAP sessions that are currently open. It is possible for a single SAP connection to have multiple sessions, for example if the active SAP connection opens a second session.

SAPSessionsJSON.title: SAP sessions JSON
SAPSessionsJSON.description: The properties of the open SAP sessions, in JSON format. This list will contain many properties such as the session name, the connection name that owns the session and the name of the user.

post.description: Attaches IA-Connect to an open SAP session. This action can be used to switch control to any new SAP sessions that are opened within an existing connection.

SearchConnectionName.title: Search SAP connection name
SearchConnectionName.description: The name of the SAP connection to connect to. If you are unsure of the connection name, this can be returned from the action 'Get SAP sessions'.

SearchSessionName.title: Search SAP session name
SearchSessionName.description: The name of the SAP session to connect to. If you are unsure of the session name, this can be returned from the action 'Get SAP sessions'.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

AttachedConnectionName.title: Attached connection name
AttachedConnectionName.description: The name of the connection that was attached to.

AttachedSessionName.title: Attached session name
AttachedSessionName.description: The name of the session that was attached to.

post.description: Closes an open SAP session.

CloseAttachedSession.title: Close attached session
CloseAttachedSession.description: If set to true then the session that IA-Connect is currently attached to will be closed, as opposed to searching for a specific session.

SearchConnectionName.title: Search SAP connection name
SearchConnectionName.description: The name of the SAP connection containing the session to close to (or leave blank to close a session in the first connection).

SearchSessionName.title: Search SAP session name
SearchSessionName.description: The name of the SAP session to close (or leave blank to close the first session). As sessions are contained within connections, the SAP connection must have been found.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Returns information about the SAP session that IA-Connect is attached to.

ConnectedToSession.title: Connected to session
ConnectedToSession.description: Returns true if IA-Connect is currently connected to an SAP session.

SessionError.title: Session connection error
SessionError.description: Returns any error messages reported by the SAP session.

SessionName.title: Session name
SessionName.description: The name of the session IA-Connect is connected to.

SessionSystemName.title: Session system name
SessionSystemName.description: The name of the system that the currently connected session is connected to, for example NPL.

Busy.title: Session is busy
Busy.description: Returns true if the SAP session is reporting that it is currently busy.

LoggedInUser.title: Logged in user
LoggedInUser.description: The username of the logged in user.

ActiveTransaction.title: Active transaction
ActiveTransaction.description: The name of the active transaction if one is currently running.

post.summary: Wait for attached SAP session not busy
post.description: Waits for the attached SAP session to report that it is no longer busy.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The number of seconds to wait for the attached SAP session to report that it is no longer busy.

RaiseExceptionIfBusyAfterWait.title: Raise exception if busy after wait
RaiseExceptionIfBusyAfterWait.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the attached SAP session is still reporting that it is busy after the wait period?

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

BusyAfterWait.title: Session busy after wait
BusyAfterWait.description: Returns true if the attached SAP session is still reporting that it is busy after the wait period, or false if not.

post.description: Inputs text into an SAP element (typically a text entry field), either replacing the existing text or inserting the new value at a specific position.

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id
SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

TextToInput.title: Text to input
TextToInput.description: The text value to input or blank if you wish to clear the existing value.

ReplaceExistingValue.title: Replace existing value
ReplaceExistingValue.description: If there is existing text in the element, should this be replaced?

InsertPosition.title: Insert position
InsertPosition.description: The position (index) to begin inserting text. If there is existing text, the insert position can be used to insert at a specific position within the existing text.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Returns all properties of an SAP element. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id
SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SAPElementType.title: Element type
SAPElementType.description: The SAP type of the element, for example 'GuiTextField'.

SAPElementTypeCode.title: Element type code
SAPElementTypeCode.description: The SAP type code, for example 31 for 'GuiTextField'.

SAPElementName.title: Element name
SAPElementName.description: The SAP name of the element.

SAPElementId.title: Element Id
SAPElementId.description: The SAP ID of the element.

SAPElementSubType.title: Element sub type
SAPElementSubType.description: The SAP sub type of the element. This is dependent on the element type and some elements may not have a sub type.

SAPElementTextValue.title: Element text value
SAPElementTextValue.description: The text value of the SAP element.

SAPElementIsContainer.title: Element is container
SAPElementIsContainer.description: Returns true if the element is a container (for example a GuiMainWindow or GuiUserArea), or false if not.

SAPElementNumberOfChildren.title: Number of children
SAPElementNumberOfChildren.description: The number of child elements, if the element is a container.

SAPElementIsChangeable.title: Element is changeable
SAPElementIsChangeable.description: Returns true if the element is changeable or false if not.

SAPElementIsModified.title: Element is modified
SAPElementIsModified.description: Returns true if the element has been modified or false if not.

SAPElementIsSelected.title: Element is selected
SAPElementIsSelected.description: Returns true if the element is currently selected (e.g. for radio buttons or checkboxes) or false if not.

SAPElementIsHighlighted.title: Element is highlighted
SAPElementIsHighlighted.description: Returns true if the element is currently highlighted (e.g. for labels or text boxes) or false if not.

SAPElementIsVisible.title: Element is visible
SAPElementIsVisible.description: Returns true if the element is currently visible or false if not.

SAPElementLeftEdge.title: Element left edge
SAPElementLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the element or window and the left edge of the display.

SAPElementTopEdge.title: Element top edge
SAPElementTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the element or window and the top edge of the display.

SAPElementWidth.title: Element width
SAPElementWidth.description: The width of the element in pixels.

SAPElementHeight.title: Element height
SAPElementHeight.description: The height of the element in pixels.

SAPElementRightEdge.title: Element right edge
SAPElementRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the element or window and the right edge of the display.

SAPElementBottomEdge.title: Element bottom edge
SAPElementBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the element or window and the bottom edge of the display.

SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The number of seconds to wait for the SAP element to exist.

RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.title: Raise exception if element not found
RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the SAP element does not exist after the wait period?

SearchSAPWindowTitle.title: Search SAP window title
SearchSAPWindowTitle.description: The title of the SAP window.

SearchIsRegularExpression.title: Search is regular expression
SearchIsRegularExpression.description: If set to true, the search window name is treated as a regular expression. For example, ^S for a window title that starts with S or P$ for a window title that ends with P. If set to false (the default), the search window name is treated as an exact match.

SearchIsCaseSensitive.title: Search is case sensitive
SearchIsCaseSensitive.description: Should the window title search be case sensitive?

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The number of seconds to wait for the SAP window to exist.

RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.title: Raise exception if element not found
RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the SAP window does not exist after the wait period?

SAPElementType.description: The SAP type of the element, for example 'GuiMainWindow'.

SAPElementTypeCode.title: Element type code
SAPElementTypeCode.description: The SAP type code, for example 21 for 'GuiMainWindow'.

SAPElementName.title: Element name
SAPElementName.description: The SAP name of the element.

SAPElementSubType.title: Element sub type
SAPElementSubType.description: The SAP sub type of the element. This is dependent on the element type and some elements may not have a sub type.

DetectParentWindowElement.description: If set to true and a SAP ID for an element is provided (for example a text box or button) then the associated SAP window will be automatically detected and the virtual key will be sent to the window. If set to False then the SAP window element Id itself must be specified (for example 'wnd[0]') or an exception will be raised.

post.summary: Bring SAP window to the front
post.description: Brings a SAP window to the front.

SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

ToggleWindow.title: Toggle window
ToggleWindow.description: Should the window be toggled by attempting to focus or click it? This helps to ensure that the window is reliably brought to the foreground.

ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.title: Toggle uses global left mouse click agent
ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies whether to use global mouse clicks to focus the IA-Connect Agent first.

ToggleDelay.title: Toggle delay in seconds
ToggleDelay.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies the pause after toggling.

DetectParentWindowElement.title: Detect parent window element
DetectParentWindowElement.description: If set to true and a SAP ID for an element is provided (for example a text box or button) then the associated SAP window will be automatically detected and the command will be sent to the window. If set to False then the SAP window element Id itself must be specified (for example 'wnd[0]') or an exception will be raised.

post.summary: Global left mouse click on SAP element
post.description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP element and clicks the left mouse button.

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id
SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SetElementWindowTopMost.title: Set element window topmost
SetElementWindowTopMost.description: Should IA-Connect set the SAP window containing the element topmost (on top of all other windows) before interacting with it? This helps ensure that no other windows are in front but will not work if using published applications (for example with Citrix) because the topmost setting in the remote session does not impact the local session.

BringElementWindowToFront.title: Bring element window to front
BringElementWindowToFront.description: Should IA-Connect bring the SAP window containing the element to the front before interacting with it? This helps ensure that no other windows are in front.

ToggleWindow.title: Toggle window
ToggleWindow.description: Should the window be toggled by attempting to focus or click it? This helps to ensure that the window is reliably brought to the foreground.

ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.title: Toggle uses global left mouse click agent
ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies whether to use global mouse clicks to focus the IA-Connect Agent first.

ToggleDelay.title: Toggle delay in seconds
ToggleDelay.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies the pause after toggling.

ClickOffsetX.title: Click offset X
ClickOffsetX.description: The number of X pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (right) and negative (left) offset values.

ClickOffsetY.title: Click offset Y
ClickOffsetY.description: The number of Y pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (down) and negative (up) offset values.

OffsetRelativeTo.title: Offset relative to
OffsetRelativeTo.description: The relative position of the element to offset from (Center / Centre / Middle, Left, Right, Top, Bottom, Top Left, Top Right, Bottom Left, Bottom Right).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SetElementWindowTopMost.description: Should IA-Connect set the SAP window containing the element topmost (on top of all other windows) before interacting with it? This helps ensure that no other windows are in front but will not work if using published applications (for example with Citrix) because the topmost setting in the remote session does not impact the local session.

BringElementWindowToFront.title: Bring element window to front
BringElementWindowToFront.description: Should IA-Connect bring the SAP window containing the element to the front before interacting with it? This helps ensure that no other windows are in front.

ToggleWindow.title: Toggle window
ToggleWindow.description: Should the window be toggled by attempting to focus or click it? This helps to ensure that the window is reliably brought to the foreground.

ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.title: Toggle uses global left mouse click agent
ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies whether to use global mouse clicks to focus the IA-Connect Agent first.

ToggleDelay.title: Toggle delay in seconds
ToggleDelay.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies the pause after toggling.

ClickOffsetX.title: Click offset X
ClickOffsetX.description: The number of X pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (right) and negative (left) offset values.

ClickOffsetY.title: Click offset Y
ClickOffsetY.description: The number of Y pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (down) and negative (up) offset values.

OffsetRelativeTo.title: Offset relative to
OffsetRelativeTo.description: The relative position of the element to offset from (Center / Centre / Middle, Left, Right, Top, Bottom, Top Left, Top Right, Bottom Left, Bottom Right).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.summary: Global input text into SAP element
post.description: Moves the mouse to centre of the SAP element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a text input that will not accept native input methods.

SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

SetElementWindowTopMost.title: Set element window topmost

ToggleDelay.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies the pause after toggling.

GlobalMouseClickOnElement.title: Global left mouse click on element
GlobalMouseClickOnElement.description: Should a global mouse click be performed at the element coordinates (to focus the element) before entering text?

ReplaceExistingValueUsingDoubleClickDele.title: Replace existing value using double mouse click delete
ReplaceExistingValueUsingDoubleClickDele.description: Should any existing value be replaced by double clicking the mouse (to highlight it) and then deleting?

ReplaceExistingValueUsingCTRLADelete.title: Replace existing value using CTRL-A delete
ReplaceExistingValueUsingCTRLADelete.description: Should any existing value be replaced by pressing Ctrl-A (to highlight all) and then deleting? Some elements may not support highlighting with Ctrl-A in which case the alternative option of 'Replace existing value using double mouse click delete' should be tried.

TextToInput.title: Text to input
TextToInput.description: The text value to global input using the keyboard.

SendKeyEvents.title: Use send key events
SendKeyEvents.description: If set to true then send key events (a lower level API which sends simulated keystrokes to the operating system) will be used. If set to false then send keys (a higher level API which sends keystrokes to the focused element) will be used instead.

KeyIntervalInMilliseconds.title: Key interval in milliseconds
KeyIntervalInMilliseconds.description: The number of milliseconds between each key press.

DoubleClickIntervalInMilliseconds.title: Double click interval in milliseconds
DoubleClickIntervalInMilliseconds.description: The number of milliseconds between each click if the parameter 'Replace existing value using double mouse click delete' is set to true.

DontInterpretSymbols.title: Dont interpret symbols
DontInterpretSymbols.description: Should symbols in the 'Text to input' not be interpreted as special keys (e.g. + for Shift, ^ for Ctrl)? This should be set to true if you are attempting to input the actual symbols.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

CurrentlySelectedValue.title: Currently selected value

CurrentlySelectedKey.title: Currently selected key

ValueRequired.title: Value required

post.summary: Get all SAP child element properties
post.description: Returns all properties of all SAP child elements. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id
SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

FirstItemToReturn.title: First item to return
FirstItemToReturn.description: The element index of the first item to return, starting from 1. If you wish to return the elements in the reverse order (from the bottom of the tree), you can alternatively specify a negative index starting from -1. For example, an index of -10 would return the tenth item from the bottom.

MaxItemsToReturn.title: Max items to return
MaxItemsToReturn.description: The maximum number of child elements to return. This parameter can be used to return large sets of elements in smaller chunks, for example large tables. Instead of attempting to return the entire table which may cause a timeout for extremely large tables, you could instead return 500 rows at a time.

SearchSAPElementType.title: Search SAP element type
SearchSAPElementType.description: The type of SAP element to search for (for example, GuiButton) or leave blank for all element types.

MaxTextLength.title: Max text length
MaxTextLength.description: The maximum length of any text field. Setting a maximum value can increase search speed as some properties can contain large amounts of text. By default, there is no maximum text length so full values will be returned.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfChildElementsReturned.title: Number of child elements returned
NumberOfChildElementsReturned.description: The number of child elements returned.

MoreElementsAvailableAtCurrentDepth.title: More elements available
MoreElementsAvailableAtCurrentDepth.description: Returns true if there were more child elements available but the inputs 'First item to return' or 'Max items to return' limited the search results.

SAPChildElementsJSON.title: SAP child elements JSON
SAPChildElementsJSON.description: A list of all located child elements (and their properties), in JSON format.

post.description: Returns the properties of an SAP element as a single line list (single line collection / data table) instead of individual items, this maybe useful depending on how you intend to use the data.

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id

By default, this value is 0 which does not limit the maximum size.

NumberOfSAPSessions.title: Number of SAP sessions
NumberOfSAPSessions.description: The number of SAP sessions that are open in the connection.

ConnectedSessionName.title: Connected session name
ConnectedSessionName.description: The internal name of the connection that was opened, for example ses[0].

NumberOfVisibleRows.description: The number of visible rows in the table.

NumberOfVisibleColumns.title: Number of visible columns
NumberOfVisibleColumns.description: The number of visible columns in the table.

VerticalScrollbarMinimum.title: Vertical scrollbar minimum
VerticalScrollbarMinimum.description: The minimum value of the vertical scrollbar.

VerticalScrollbarMaximum.title: Vertical scrollbar maximum
VerticalScrollbarMaximum.description: The maximum value of the vertical scrollbar.

VerticalScrollbarPosition.title: Vertical scrollbar position
VerticalScrollbarPosition.description: The current position of the vertical scrollbar.

VerticalScrollbarPageSize.title: Vertical scrollbar page size
VerticalScrollbarPageSize.description: The page size of the vertical scrollbar.

EstimatedNumberOfRows.title: Estimated number of rows
EstimatedNumberOfRows.description: The estimated number of rows in the table, including rows that are not currently visible.

HorizontalScrollbarMinimum.title: Horizontal scrollbar minimum
HorizontalScrollbarMinimum.description: The minimum value of the horizontal scrollbar.

HorizontalScrollbarMaximum.title: Horizontal scrollbar maximum
HorizontalScrollbarMaximum.description: The maximum value of the horizontal scrollbar.

HorizontalScrollbarPosition.title: Horizontal scrollbar position
HorizontalScrollbarPosition.description: The current position of the horizontal scrollbar.

HorizontalScrollbarPageSize.description: The page size of the horizontal scrollbar.

EstimatedNumberOfColumns.title: Estimated number of columns
EstimatedNumberOfColumns.description: The estimated number of columns in the table, including rows that are not currently visible.

RowSelectMode.title: Row selection mode
RowSelectMode.description: The current row selection mode, for example 'No selection' or 'Single selection'.

ColumnSelectMode.title: Column selection mode
ColumnSelectMode.description: The current column selection mode, for example 'No selection' or 'Single selection'.

post.summary: Get SAP table visible cell text contents
post.description: Gets the contents of a visible table cell at the specified row and column index within a table. Row index 1, column index 1 represents the top left corner of the visible cells in the table. This action can only be used to retrieve the contents of visible cells.

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id
SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

VisibleRowIndex.title: Visible row index
VisibleRowIndex.description: The row index of the visible table cell, starting from 1.

VisibleColumnIndex.title: Visible column index
VisibleColumnIndex.description: The column index of the visible table cell, starting from 1.

CheckedElementValue.title: Checked element value
CheckedElementValue.description: For GuiRadioBox or GuiCheckBox elements contained within a table, what value should be returned if they are selected / checked? By default, this is 'True' (as text).

CellTextContents.title: Cell text contents
CellTextContents.description: The contents of the visible cell.

CellColumnName.title: Cell column name

HorizontalScrollbarPosition.title: Horizontal scrollbar position
HorizontalScrollbarPosition.description: The current position of the horizontal scrollbar.

VerticalScrollbarPosition.title: Vertical scrollbar position
VerticalScrollbarPosition.description: The current position of the vertical scrollbar.

EstimatedActualRowIndex.title: Estimated actual row index
EstimatedActualRowIndex.description: The estimated actual row index in the table, including rows that are not currently visible.

EstimatedActualColumnIndex.title: Estimated actual column index
EstimatedActualColumnIndex.description: The estimated actual column index in the table, including columns that are not currently visible.

post.summary: Get SAP table visible cell properties

SearchSAPElementId.title: Search SAP element Id
SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

VisibleRowIndex.title: Visible row index
VisibleRowIndex.description: The row index of the visible table cell, starting from 1.

VisibleColumnIndex.title: Visible column index

SAPElementType.title: Element type
SAPElementType.description: The SAP type of the element, for example 'GuiTextField'.

SAPElementTypeCode.title: Element type code
SAPElementTypeCode.description: The SAP type code, for example 31 for 'GuiMainWindow'.

SAPElementName.title: Element name
SAPElementName.description: The SAP name of the element.

SAPElementId.title: Element Id
SAPElementId.description: The SAP ID of the element.

SAPElementSubType.title: Element sub type
SAPElementSubType.description: The SAP sub type of the element. This is dependent on the element type and some elements may not have a sub type.

SAPElementTextValue.title: Element text value
SAPElementTextValue.description: The text value of the SAP element.

SAPElementIsContainer.title: Element is container
SAPElementIsContainer.description: Returns true if the element is a container (for example a GuiMainWindow or GuiUserArea), or false if not.

SAPElementNumberOfChildren.title: Number of children
SAPElementNumberOfChildren.description: The number of child elements, if the element is a container.

SAPElementIsChangeable.title: Element is changeable
SAPElementIsChangeable.description: Returns true if the element is changeable or false if not.

SAPElementIsModified.title: Element is modified
SAPElementIsModified.description: Returns true if the element has been modified or false if not.

SAPElementIsSelected.title: Element is selected
SAPElementIsSelected.description: Returns true if the element is currently selected (e.g. for radio buttons or checkboxes) or false if not.

SAPElementIsHighlighted.title: Element is highlighted
SAPElementIsHighlighted.description: Returns true if the element is currently highlighted (e.g. for labels or text boxes) or false if not.

SAPElementIsVisible.title: Element is visible
SAPElementIsVisible.description: Returns true if the element is currently visible or false if not.

SAPElementLeftEdge.title: Element left edge
SAPElementLeftEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the left edge of the element or window and the left edge of the display.

SAPElementTopEdge.title: Element top edge
SAPElementTopEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the top edge of the element or window and the top edge of the display.

SAPElementWidth.title: Element width
SAPElementWidth.description: The width of the element in pixels.

SAPElementHeight.title: Element height
SAPElementHeight.description: The height of the element in pixels.

SAPElementRightEdge.title: Element right edge
SAPElementRightEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the right edge of the element or window and the left edge of the display.

SAPElementBottomEdge.title: Element bottom edge
SAPElementBottomEdge.description: The distance in pixels between the bottom edge of the element or window and the top edge of the display.

CellColumnName.title: Cell column name
CellColumnName.description: The name of the column which contains the visible cell.

HorizontalScrollbarPosition.title: Horizontal scrollbar position
HorizontalScrollbarPosition.description: The current position of the horizontal scrollbar.

VerticalScrollbarPosition.title: Vertical scrollbar position
VerticalScrollbarPosition.description: The current position of the vertical scrollbar.

EstimatedActualRowIndex.title: Estimated actual row index
EstimatedActualRowIndex.description: The estimated actual row index in the table, including rows that are not currently visible.

EstimatedActualColumnIndex.title: Estimated actual column index
EstimatedActualColumnIndex.description: The estimated actual column index in the table, including columns that are not currently visible.

VisibleRowIndex.title: Visible row index

CheckCellElement.title: Check cell element
CheckCellElement.description: If set to true, the visible table cell will be checked. If set to false, it will be unchecked.

post.summary: Get SAP table visible text contents

SearchSAPElementId.description: The SAP element ID of the element to interact with. This can be discovered via Inspection.

FirstVisibleRowToReturn.title: First visible row to return
FirstVisibleRowToReturn.description: The row index of the first visible table row to return, starting from 1.

MaxRowsToReturn.title: Max rows to return
MaxRowsToReturn.description: The maximum number of rows to return, or 0 to return all rows.

FirstVisibleColumnToReturn.title: First visible column to return
FirstVisibleColumnToReturn.description: The column index of the first visible table column to return, starting from 1.

MaxColumnsToReturn.title: Max columns to return
MaxColumnsToReturn.description: The maximum number of columns to return, or 0 to return all columns.

UseColumnHeadersFromTable.title: Use column headers from table
UseColumnHeadersFromTable.description: If set to true then the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to setup the returned table columns to match the column names in the SAP table.

ReturnRowIndexInOutputCollection.title: Return row index in output collection
ReturnRowIndexInOutputCollection.description: If set to true then the IA-Connect Agent will return the row index in the output collection as an additional column. This is useful if you plan to filter the data since you will be able to track which row this originally came from. By default, the column name for the row index will be '_Row_index_' but you can change it by providing an alternative value in the input 'Name of column to store row index'.

NameOfColumnToStoreRowIndex.title: Name of column to store row index
NameOfColumnToStoreRowIndex.description: If 'Return row index in output collection' is set to true then you can override the default column name of '_Row_Index' by providing an alternative value here.

CheckedElementValue.title: Checked element value
CheckedElementValue.description: For GuiRadioBox or GuiCheckBox elements contained within a table, what value should be returned if they are selected / checked? By default, this is 'True' (as text).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfColumnsReturned.description: The number of columns returned. This may be limited by the 'First visible column to return' or 'Max columns to return' inputs.

ParentNodeKey.description: If specified then the tree will be processed from the specified node key (note that you can obtain node keys by calling this action with a blank parent node key - that will provide the keys at the top-level). If not specified then the top-level of the tree will be processed.

ProcessSubNodes.title: Process sub nodes
ProcessSubNodes.description: If set to true, all nodes in the tree (including subnodes) will be returned. If set to false, only the top-level nodes will be returned.

SearchNodeTextIsRegularExpression.title: Search node text is regular expression
SearchNodeTextIsRegularExpression.description: If set to true, the search node text is treated as a regular expression. For example, ^S for a node that starts with S or P$ for a node that ends with P. If set to false (the default), the search node text is treated as an exact match.

SearchNodeTextIsCaseSensitive.title: Search node text is case sensitive
SearchNodeTextIsCaseSensitive.description: Should the node text search be case sensitive?

SearchColumnName.title: Search column name

SetElementWindowTopMost.title: Set element window topmost
SetElementWindowTopMost.description: Should IA-Connect set the SAP window containing the element topmost (on top of all other windows) before interacting with it? This helps ensure that no other windows are in front but will not work if using published applications (for example with Citrix) because the topmost setting in the remote session does not impact the local session.

BringElementWindowToFront.title: Bring element window to front
BringElementWindowToFront.description: Should IA-Connect bring the SAP window containing the element to the front before interacting with it? This helps ensure that no other windows are in front.

ToggleWindow.title: Toggle window
ToggleWindow.description: Should the window be toggled by attempting to focus or click it? This helps to ensure that the window is reliably brought to the foreground.

ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.title: Toggle uses global left mouse click agent
ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies whether to use global mouse clicks to focus the IA-Connect Agent first.

ToggleDelay.title: Toggle delay in seconds
ToggleDelay.description: If choosing to toggle the window, this specifies the pause after toggling.

ClickOffsetX.title: Click offset X
ClickOffsetX.description: The number of X pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (right) and negative (left) offset values.

ClickOffsetY.title: Click offset Y
ClickOffsetY.description: The number of Y pixels to offset the click action by. This parameter supports both positive (down) and negative (up) offset values.

OffsetRelativeTo.title: Offset relative to
OffsetRelativeTo.description: The relative position of the element to offset from (Center / Centre / Middle, Left, Right, Top, Bottom, Top Left, Top Right, Bottom Left, Bottom Right).

FirstRowToReturn.description: The row index of the first grid view row to return, starting from 1.

MaxRowsToReturn.description: The maximum number of rows to return, or 0 to return all rows.

FirstSearchColumnName.title: First search column name
FirstSearchColumnName.description: The internal name of the first column to read from. This can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP grid view column headers' and providing the values shown in the 'ColumnName' column.

MaxColumnsToReturn.title: Max columns to return
MaxColumnsToReturn.description: The maximum number of columns to return, or 0 to return all columns.

UseColumnHeadersFromTable.title: Use column headers from grid view
UseColumnHeadersFromTable.description: If set to true then the IA-Connect Agent will attempt to setup the returned columns to match the column names in the SAP grid view.

ReturnRowIndexInOutputCollection.title: Return row index in output collection
ReturnRowIndexInOutputCollection.description: If set to true then the IA-Connect Agent will return the row index in the output collection as an additional column. This is useful if you plan to filter the data since you will be able to track which row this originally came from. By default, the column name for the row index will be '_Row_index_' but you can change it by providing an alternative value in the input 'Name of column to store row index'.

NameOfColumnToStoreRowIndex.title: Name of column to store row index
NameOfColumnToStoreRowIndex.description: If 'Return row index in output collection' is set to true then you can override the default column name of '_Row_Index' by providing an alternative value here.

CheckedElementValue.title: Checked element value
CheckedElementValue.description: For GuiRadioBox or GuiCheckBox elements contained within the grid view, what value should be returned if they are selected / checked? By default, this is 'True' (as text).
